Class FileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileReader

  • public class FileReader
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the File Reading and Character matching and word substitution assignment.
    This program works like mad libs, in that a the user fills in parts of speech in a story to create a new story

    Author:
    Patrick Riley

        Returns:

      • findWords

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> findWords(java.util.Scanner mdLib)

        finds the placeholders designated within the file that will be replaced

        Parameters:
        mdLib - the file with the missing words
        Returns:
        ArrayList<String> parts of speech to be replaced by actual words

      • setWords

        public static void setWords(java.util.Scanner mdLib,
                            java.lang.String fname,
                            boolean fromFile,
                            java.lang.String repFName,
                            java.io.PrintWriter out)

        this takes the words to be replaced and add them in the correct places in the file, then outputs the changed file

        Parameters:
        mdLib - this is the scanner of the unfilled poem
        fname - the file name mdLib is refrencing
        fromFile - if the words are going to be from a file or not
        repFName - if the new words are coming from a file, this is the file name of it
        out - the printWriter used to print to the output void
